page.title: 18National parks - Footpaths
page.content: {The Peak District National Park.} The village of Holme lies on the northern borders of the Peak District National Park in one of the least known parts called the 'Dark Peak'. It is made up mostly of steep sided valleys and rough moorland. It is particularly convenient for the towns of Lancashire where work was mainly for the Pottery Industry and West Yorkshire where the woollen textile towns grew up. The entrance to the Peak District National Park which is in our area is clearly recognisable by the huge mill wheel of Millstone Grit set in local sandstone. {The Pennine Way.} The Pennine way passes near Holme and it is 250 miles long. The Pennine Way runs from Edale in the south to Roxbugshire on the Scottish border. It was completed in April 1965.
